page.title: 17Brenkley Colliery
page.content: Ray Lowes, the training officer, and Eddie Haynes, a retired Mining Surveyor answered our questions. They get 1600 tonnes of coal from the mine each day; steamcoal for power stations, household, coking coal and anthracite. 480 men and 4 women work there. Last year (1984) all of them were on strike. They cut coal with 3 shearer units and one coal cutter. About 110 men work on each shift. They wear boiler suits, helmets, gloves, safety glasses,boots,masks,belts and lamps. They also use picks,shovels and axes.3 buses take men from the pithead to the drift.You must be 16 to work in the mine. Some men retire at 50,others at 65. There are over 80 rooms, including 16 offices and a canteen. The first shaft opened in 1844 and the present drift will close for ever in Autumn 1986.
